com.dnastack.beacon.client

Interface BeaconClient


  • public interface BeaconClient
    Beacon client API.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Artem (tema.voskoboynick@gmail.com), Miro Cupak (mirocupak@gmail.com)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Gets beacon information.

        Gets beacon information.

        Throws:

      • getBeaconAlleleResponse

        org.ga4gh.beacon.BeaconAlleleResponse getBeaconAlleleResponse(String referenceName,
                                                              long start,
                                                              String referenceBases,
                                                              String alternateBases,
                                                              String assemblyId,
                                                              List<String> datasetIds,
                                                              boolean includeDatasetResponses)
                                                       throws InternalException
        Gets response to a beacon query for allele information.
        Parameters:
        referenceName - reference name (chromosome). Accepted values: 1-22, X, Y.
        start - Position, allele locus (0-based). Accepted values: non-negative integers smaller than reference length.
        referenceBases - reference bases for this variant (starting from `start`). Accepted values: see the REF field in VCF 4.2 specification (https://samtools.github.io/hts-specs/VCFv4.2.pdf).
        alternateBases - the bases that appear instead of the reference bases. Accepted values: see the ALT field in VCF 4.2 specification (https://samtools.github.io/hts-specs/VCFv4.2.pdf).
        assemblyId - assembly identifier (GRC notation, e.g. `GRCh37`).
        datasetIds - identifiers of datasets. If this field is null, all datasets will be queried.
        includeDatasetResponses - indicator of whether responses for individual datasets should be included (not null) in the response. If null, the default value of false is assumed.
        Returns:
        beacon allele response
        Throws:
        InternalException - when an internal error occurs
